Author: Pigeons_r_life
Text: I thinks it’s become extremely apparent that the glamorized body types are very artificial; as strong of a force as the skinny-idolizing culture was, there’s an increasingly equal force denouncing that on most social media platforms. I don’t see a problem in criticizing the culture in general, but outing specific individuals solely based on speculation is a bit insensitive, especially if that’s something we would all be horrified to experience. Of course, if they admit to their problems that’s a different conversation, but assuming someone has an ED based on their figure and then vocalizing that assumption is just propagating some of the same ideas we despise.

Author: katebishophawkguy
Text: because a lot of people look at these celebrities as body goals and get the messed up impression that there's something wrong with them for not looking like them, especially if they start to copy their habits so it brings a weird sense of justification realizing they don't even naturally look that way- like when people realized taylor swift was super underweight because of an ed instead of exercising a lot as she claimed
